briefdescription.para: Add an existing option to the Option_group.
Add an existing option to the Option_group.
Add a bunch of options to the group.
Add an existing subcommand to be a member of an option_group.

memberdef.argsstring: (std::string option_name, callback_t option_callback, std::string option_description="", bool defaulted=false, std::function< std::string()> func={})
memberdef.name: add_option

briefdescription.para: Add an option, will automatically understand the type for common types.

detaileddescription.para: To use, create a variable with the expected type, and pass it in after the name. After start is called, you can use count to see if the value was passed, and the value will be initialized properly. Numbers, vectors, and strings are supported.
->required(), ->default, and the validators are options, The positional options take an optional number of arguments.
For example, std::string filename; program.add_option("filename", filename, "description of filename");

briefdescription.para: Add option for assigning to a variable.
Add option with no description or variable assignment.

param.type: enable_if_t< std::is_const< T >::value &&std::is_constructible< std::string, T >::value, detail::enabler >

briefdescription.para: Add option with description but with no variable assignment or callback.
Add a subcommand. Inherits INHERITABLE and OptionDefaults, and help flag.
Add a previously created app as a subcommand.
Extension of App to better manage groups of options.
